manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: PIXMA TS702a Wireless Printer THE HIGH PERFORMANCE PRINTER FOR THE HOME & OFFICE Meet the PIXMA TS702a - built for fast print speeds, a large paper capacity and the connectivity you need for the home & office. Print documents quickly fast print speeds in as little as 10 seconds.[1] Made to handle big jobs, the PIXMA TS702a features a large paper capacity of up to 350 sheets and is compatible with high yield XL and XXL ink tanks, so you won’t have to worry about replacing ink tanks during large print jobs. Connectivity is paramount, so you can connect the device you need- how you need to, and without worry. The PIXMA TS702a is the high-performance printer for the home & office.

EFFICIENT EVERYDAY PRINTING The PIXMA TS702a has a 5-Color Individual Ink System and a 350-sheet plain paper capacity, which means it’s ready for lots of detailed documents fast with sharp black text. It can print great looking borderless photos[3] and even supports various paper types & sizes, from 3.5” x 3.5” Square up to legal size paper. ENHANCED CONNECTIVITY With lots of connectivity options you can connect the PIXMA TS702a at home or at the office. You can print from all your favorite devices, whether that is a smartphone, tablet or computer. Have peace of mind and connect with AirPrint(R)[4], Mopria(R) Print Service[5], Wi-Fi(R)[7], or Ethernet. VOICE ACTIVATED PRINTING The PIXMA TS702a is compatible with Amazon Alexa[2] and Google Assistant[2]. With voice-activated printing, simply ask your Canon printer to print countless things like lists, templates, and coloring pages, to even check your ink levels and read printer notifications BIG PERFORMACE IN A COMPACT DESIGN A small printer shouldn’t have to mean slow print speeds, and with the PIXMA TS702a - it doesn’t. Even with its small footprint, it has a fast print speed of 15 ipm[1] for single-page documents and even just 21 seconds for a 4” x 6” photo.[1]
Unlock the full potential of your printer with the Canon PRINT App. Print photos or documents right from your mobile devices or cloud services with the convenient Canon PRINT App.[9]

Wireless Connect Complete your printer setup quickly and easily on your Apple(R) or Android(TM) device using the printer’s Wireless Connect button.[8] Smartphone Copy With Smartphone Copy, using the Canon PRINT app[9], use your smartphone to quickly and easily scan, adjust, and print your documents and photos. Mopria Print Service Connect to Mopria(R) Print Service to print what you need from your favorite Android(TM) device.[5] AirPrint Use Apple AirPrint(R) to wirelessly print documents and photos straight from your iPhone, iPad or Mac — no additional apps required! [4]

Disclaimers Specifications may change without notice. Not responsible for typographical errors. Document print speeds are the averages of ESAT in Office Category Test for the default simplex mode, ISO/IEC 24734. Photo print speed is based on the default setting using ISO/JIS-SCID N2 on Photo Paper Plus Glossy II and does not take into account data processing time on host computer. Print speed may vary depending on system configuration, interface, software, document complexity, print mode, page coverage, type of paper used etc. Copy speeds are the average of sFCOT and sESAT, ISO/IEC 29183. Copy speed may vary depending on document complexity, copy mode, page coverage, type of paper used etc. and does not take into account warming up time. See www.usa.canon.com/ipm for additional details.Requires an active smart assistant account linked and accompanying app enabled, the smart device and printer to be actively connected with permission to the Canon Inkjet Cloud Printing Center, and the required action(s), skill(s), or applet(s) available/enabled to the compatible printer. Voice commands can not be displayed as text on Amazon smart devices with screens.Paper types NOT supported for borderless printing are as follows: Envelope, High Resolution Paper, T-Shirt Transfer and Photo Stickers. The maximum borderless printing size is 8.5"x11".AirPrint functionality requires a compatible iPad, iPhone, or iPod Touch device running iOS 7.0 or later, and an AirPrint-enabled printer connected to the same network as your iOS device. A printer connected to the USB port of your Mac, PC, AirPort Base station, or Time Capsule is not supported.Requires Android mobile device with Android 4.4 operating system or later with the Mopria(R) Print Service pre-loaded with that device and the compatible PIXMA printer on the same wireless network. The Mopria experience is also available on Android 4.4 mobile devices with a download of the Mopria Print Service from Google Play.Specifications subject to change without notice.Wireless printing and scanning requires a working network with wireless 802.11b/g/n capability, operating at 2.4GHz. Wireless performance may vary based on terrain and distance between the printer and wireless network clients.Requires a smart device with the Canon PRINT Inkjet/SELPHY app installed and connected to the desired active wireless network to complete cableless setup.Requires an Internet connection and the Canon PRINT Inkjet/SELPHY app, available for free on the App Store and at Google Play. Compatible with iPad, iPhone 3GS or later, and iPod touch 3rd generation or later devices running iOS 7.0 or later, and Android mobile devices running Android 2.3.3 or later. Your device must be connected to the same working network with wireless 802.11 b/g/n/ac/ad capability as your printer. Requires a compatible social media account and is subject to that social media account's Terms of Service. Certain exceptions may apply.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good!!! Update: better and better
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I bought this printer mainly for printing ID cards using brainstorm's MP tray. It works beautifully; see the video. The print is almost perfect, with the exception of a little Cyan ink spill on top of the reverse side (not shown). I also printed some 5x7 photos, and they are slightly better than my HP OfficeJet 3830. It appears that this printer prints with a higher resolution. To be fair, I was using the Canon Photo Paper Plus Glossy II on both printers.Here are the bad parts Canon can improve (if they care):1. The LED/LCD screen is almost NOT readable! I thought I had received a lemon and was about ready to return it. Now I can get by with a flashlight, hahaha!2. The WiFi setup instructions suck, big time! Canon video instruction also sucks! I ended up watching a video that shows how you can connect it with onscreen instructions to do it manually. P.S. the setup process does not work with dual-band WiFi. Just spend a minute to do it manually by entering the password for your WiFi, a minor hassle.Other than that, the printer is excellent (so far)!1. Good print quality2. Large input tray, plus top loading3. Multipurpose tray for CD (included) and ID badge from the third party4. Relatively fast5. Cheap (not sure about the ink yet)Update (02-08-23): I tested it with 120 lbs 325 GSM cardstock, and amazingly it works beautifully! Settings: 5x7, rear tray, cardstock, best quality. Another pleasant surprise - the printer prints 2-sided documents pretty fast. The draft quality looks fantastic. Lastly, the bundled ink lasts for a long time. I printed 10+ full-color 5x7 photos, and it is still 1/3 being used. Will see.If you are not 100% happy with any desktop inkjet printers that are 3 years or older, recycle them and get this one. :) P.S. this may be true for any newer models, Epson, HP, Brother, etc. Technology is just making them so much better nowadays. I chose Canon because of its multipurpose tray.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a Decent Printer. Works great, Prints great. I like the fact that paper can be loaded from the top and from the bottom tray. Your Choice. Also Prints at Decent speed. Quality is Excellent. I also love the fact that it's Wireless.... Which brings me to my one complaint. Sometimes when turning the printer on and getting ready to print... It's slow about being recognized by the computer. I'm assuming it has something to do with my wifi network, so maybe that's just a problem I have, I don't know... but I have turned the printer on and a minute after it boots up, I try to print, and the computer tells me the printer is not ON. Not always but Sometimes the Printer takes about 30 to 60 seconds to recognize the command. Then it starts printing and Everything is fine. But overall. Great Printer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I bought this printer to convert this to an edible printer and it works so well!
reviews.reviewText: It works very well. Setup is easy! The instructions are very clear. I would definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great.. but something's weird
reviews.reviewText: I have a Win 10 PC. The printer replaces my 4 year old iP7200 which stopped printing in color and problems with the paper rollers. The TS702a is an excellent printer in terms of print quality....once you get it installed.The installation setup was puzzling. I carefully followed all the steps in the Getting Started booklet, downloaded the set-up file, clicked Start Setup and went through the motions, selecting UBS cable connection, but the driver installation failed. Next thing I know, the printer is printing out the alignment patterns. The little screen (why Canon couldn't rig up a tiny backlight for illumination is beyond me) then went to normal configuration showing the 5 squares for each color. I had to add the printer to my Windows Devices directory in Settings and was able to print out a test page. However, the driver was not listed in the Control Panel-Programs directory. OK..let's see what happens. I picked out a sample text from Documents, selected Print and, voila, out it came.I decided to delete the printer from the Devices list and delete the downloaded setup software and start from scratch, this time setting it up for wireless connection to my router. Same thing... everything went well except the driver installation failed again. But, as before, I was able to operate the printer (after reinstalling it in the Devices directory), but the driver still was not listed in the Programs directory. Hey...if it works, let it be! I'll be calling Canon tech support about all this.Draft print speed is very good, but duplex printing is very slow. It takes a full 15 seconds to go from the end of printing on one side of the page to the start of printing on the other side. On my old iP7200, the cycle was completed in less than half the time. Very disappointing.Finally, you have to remember to pull out the output tray before you print or you'll get an error message on your monitor. With the iP7200, there's no tray, but a door that opens automatically if you forgot to do it when you start to print. But the main thing is that if it prints text well and has good, accurate color graphics and photos, I'll be happy.
